Squizzy::

She smiled sweetly and said in a cheerful voice,"Well, near as I can 
tell, the DNA strands show that these genes here," pointing to the 
paper," will be the dominant and most useful for the transfer to 
other DNA combinations.  But even the resesive genes will come in 
handy.  See if you put these genes with these ones over here, you can 
basically enginer the best trates for the bot and animal modes that 
you want. But as this shows, it's only one bot's genes. But if you 
got other samples from other bots, with a little time, you can 
enegineer the perfect bot, brains, strength, stamina, looks, all of 
what ever you want can be made and spliced.  But I have to ask, what 
is it speficially that your looking for, genentically I mean?"

She saw that the genes she was looking at where her own, but gave no 
hint that she knew that.  She wanted to know why this femme bot 
wanted her genetics.  Even thought she was an engineer, she always 
thought that unless the bot was dead, one didn't go stealing the 
genetics of that bot without the bot's permission.  It was not 
something that one with honor did.  Despite her reprogramming, honor 
was one program that could never be taken or erased. 



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Hours passed, Lady Hawk arised from her corner. she walked over to 
the
> samples and observed the results. she didn't know alot about what 
she was
> looking at but she could see the breakdown of chromosomes and all 
that
> scientific junk. The dominant ones showed atributes that could 
possibly be
> spliced, the others would reject each other and probably cause a 
breakdown
> in the systems. she catalogued the results for future purposes.
> 
> "I'm glad to see you haven't botched my experiment, you're more 
useful than
> I thought." She said to her forced observer. She was never one to 
admit her
> mistakes, and putting down Squizzy was one mistake easily made. 
There was a
> good chance that this bot could be just the tool she needed to be
> convincing. "Look at the results and tell me what you can 
understand, I'll
> help you with anything you can't follow."
> 
>

> > Squizzy::
> > She nodded to LadyHawk. She turned her back to her and worked on 
the
> > computer, gathering the info.  She wasn't really happy with this 
bot.
> > Something about her felt fake. But she couldn't put her finger on 
it.
> > Her mongoose insticts told her that there was a snake near by. She
> > glanced back at LadyHawk and smiled. Then turned back to the 
computer
> > console. She watched as the printer printed up the sheets and she
> > folded them up and placed them on the counter for later on.
> >
> > Her sweet, innocent, friendly nature would give her the advantage.
> > She only played at being this little helpless bot that was just so
> > helpful.  She was still new enough to this group that she 
couldn't do
> > anything.  She wondered seince she was no fighter, if she could 
work
> > her way up through the ranks and see just how far she could go.  
She
> > wasn't sure if she wanted to stay with these bots yet or not.  Sh
> > also wasn't sure if they were the strongest group around. IF they
> > were the best, she would stay with them. If not, she would learn 
all
> > she could and then turn over the info to the strongest group. Her
> > survival insticts were on full swing.  For her, insticts were a 
more
> > involved thought proccess, not just a gut feeling.
> >
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:

her.

> > problems wake

she

> > > two of her eyes, keeping the third one active and on Squizzy.
